text: hi everyone I'm Robin and in this video
I'm gonna talk about some confusing
words Koreans used it even confuse me
still today
those words are sister brother and
friend and I got two stories to share
with you both in my University the first
story I was talking to one of my
university students she was a girl about
20 years old and I asked her what are
you doing tonight
so she answered she's going to meet her
sister now when she says the word sister
the only thing I think about is she's
going to meet her family okay her sister
she and her sister have the same mother
they're blood-related okay that's the
only thing I think about well a few days
later I asked her another question I
asked her you know how many people in
your family and she told me well there's
my mother my father and my two brothers
and I was like what about your sister
and she said what sister I said well a
few days ago you told me you're going to
meet your sister and she's like oh
that's my Ani
I was like oh that's not your sister why
did you say sister okay so that's a
little bit of a confusion there Koreans
like to use sister and brother for older
friends okay
in English we would only use the word
friend we would never call them a sister
or brother that's only used for family
okay my next story is similar I had two
girls in my class they always sat
together and I asked them are you
friends and one girl says no we're not
friends she's my sister well again I not
your sister because she's not your
family and she explained well they're
different ages and different ages can't
be friends and I'm like well this is a
very big culture difference because in
English in cat
or America the age of your friend
doesn't matter you know a 20 year old
can be friends with a 30 year old you
just call them your friend nothing else
but in Korea it's a little bit different
they use a in Korean brother and sister
but when they change that to English
they shouldn't say brother or sister you
can only use friend all right well I
hope you enjoyed my story and I'll see
you next time
you
